message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.IT. 

The paper proposes a formal model and solution methods for a sequential perimeter surveillance problem, which involves optimally allocating multiple searchers to segments of the perimeter to maximise the detection of intrusions. This problem involves decision-making under uncertainty and learning from observed data to improve decisions over time. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the following arXiv CS sub-categories: 

- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): This sub-category covers research on intelligent agents, decision-making under uncertainty, and machine learning, which are all relevant to the problem of adaptive policies for perimeter surveillance. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): This sub-category covers research on algorithms and models for learning from data, which is a key aspect of the proposed solution method for the perimeter surveillance problem. 
- cs.CR (Cryptography and Security): This sub-category covers research on security and privacy, which are important considerations in the context of perimeter surveillance. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): This sub-category covers research on control and optimization of complex systems, which is relevant to the problem of optimally allocating searchers to segments of the perimeter. 
- cs.IT (Information Theory): This sub-category covers research on the fundamental limits of information processing and communication, which may be relevant to the analysis of the proposed solution method for the perimeter surveillance problem.
